description:
1.version：icehouse
2.Reproduce steps:
（example）
I create a tenant called bug_test
then I cretaed two users called test1 and test2 which belong tenant bug_test
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# keystone tenant-list
+----------------------------------+----------+---------+
|                id                |   name   | enabled |
+----------------------------------+----------+---------+
| 6485ffa6b1f448919f00acab23207018 |  admin   |   True  |
| c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 | bug_test |   True  |
| dc09e51878b54448b6ed39522295bb5a | services |   True  |
+----------------------------------+----------+---------+
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# keystone user-list --tenant bug_test
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+
|                id                |  name | enabled | email |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+
| 91c422e673ad4c399aace18ba5c4f049 | test1 |   True  |       |
| be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903 | test2 |   True  |       |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+

then I  use “nova quota-update” change user test2's quota like this：

[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# nova quota-update c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 --user be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903 --instances 8
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# nova quota-show  --tenant  c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 --user be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903
+-----------------------------+-------+
| Quota                       | Limit |
+-----------------------------+-------+
| instances                   | 8     |
| cores                       | 20    |
| ram                         | 51200 |
| floating_ips                | 10    |
| fixed_ips                   | -1    |
| metadata_items              | 128   |
| injected_files              | 5     |
| injected_file_content_bytes | 10240 |
| injected_file_path_bytes    | 255   |
| key_pairs                   | 100   |
| security_groups             | 10    |
| security_group_rules        | 20    |
+-----------------------------+-------+

then i delete the user called test2

[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# keystone  user-delete  be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# keystone user-list --tenant bug_test
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+
|                id                |  name | enabled | email |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+
| 91c422e673ad4c399aace18ba5c4f049 | test1 |   True  |       |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+

Finally, I execute
“nova quota-show  --tenant  c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 --user be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903”

Expected result:

I think the system should be prompt something like：The user does not exist

but the actual result:
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# nova quota-show  --tenant  c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 --user be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903
+-----------------------------+-------+
| Quota                       | Limit |
+-----------------------------+-------+
| instances                   | 8     |
| cores                       | 20    |
| ram                         | 51200 |
| floating_ips                | 10    |
| fixed_ips                   | -1    |
| metadata_items              | 128   |
| injected_files              | 5     |
| injected_file_content_bytes | 10240 |
| injected_file_path_bytes    | 255   |
| key_pairs                   | 100   |
| security_groups             | 10    |
| security_group_rules        | 20    |
+-----------------------------+-------+

I don't think this is very reasonable
title: the command “nova quota-show” Should not display  the  quota of a user has been deleted

comments.content:
1.version：icehouse
2.Reproduce steps:
（example）
I create a tenant called bug_test 
then I cretaed two users called test1 and test2 witch belong tenant bug_test
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# keystone tenant-list
+----------------------------------+----------+---------+
|                id                |   name   | enabled |
+----------------------------------+----------+---------+
| 6485ffa6b1f448919f00acab23207018 |  admin   |   True  |
| c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 | bug_test |   True  |
| dc09e51878b54448b6ed39522295bb5a | services |   True  |
+----------------------------------+----------+---------+
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# keystone user-list --tenant bug_test
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+
|                id                |  name | enabled | email |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+
| 91c422e673ad4c399aace18ba5c4f049 | test1 |   True  |       |
| be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903 | test2 |   True  |       |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+

then I  use “nova quota-update” change user test2's tenant like this：

[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# nova quota-update c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 --user be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903 --instances 8
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# nova quota-show  --tenant  c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 --user be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903
+-----------------------------+-------+
| Quota                       | Limit |
+-----------------------------+-------+
| instances                   | 8     |
| cores                       | 20    |
| ram                         | 51200 |
| floating_ips                | 10    |
| fixed_ips                   | -1    |
| metadata_items              | 128   |
| injected_files              | 5     |
| injected_file_content_bytes | 10240 |
| injected_file_path_bytes    | 255   |
| key_pairs                   | 100   |
| security_groups             | 10    |
| security_group_rules        | 20    |
+-----------------------------+-------+

then i delete the user called test2 

[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# keystone  user-delete  be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# keystone user-list --tenant bug_test
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+
|                id                |  name | enabled | email |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+
| 91c422e673ad4c399aace18ba5c4f049 | test1 |   True  |       |
+----------------------------------+-------+---------+-------+

Finally, I execute 
“nova quota-show  --tenant  c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 --user be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903”

Expected result:

I think the system should be prompt something like：The user does not exist 

but the actual result:
[root@njq002 ~(keystone_admin)]# nova quota-show  --tenant  c93d944ee63a45e0880161608e62eb83 --user be4fb020ae8b4001afb1797d81a3d903
+-----------------------------+-------+
| Quota                       | Limit |
+-----------------------------+-------+
| instances                   | 8     |
| cores                       | 20    |
| ram                         | 51200 |
| floating_ips                | 10    |
| fixed_ips                   | -1    |
| metadata_items              | 128   |
| injected_files              | 5     |
| injected_file_content_bytes | 10240 |
| injected_file_path_bytes    | 255   |
| key_pairs                   | 100   |
| security_groups             | 10    |
| security_group_rules        | 20    |
+-----------------------------+-------+

I don't think this is very reasonable
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ni-jinquan

comments.content: When I check the database，I found all the deleted user's field values  which named 'deleted' in table " nova . project_user_quotas"will not be modified ，Generally speaking, this field should be changed to 1 or id
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ni-jinquan

comments.content:
my juno env:

comments.content:
some mistakes above

[root@migcont ~] # nova quota-show --tenant 171917e3a16f43ccb48ccb871d71973b --user 280e29cbffd14bbc887b22d8372ba119
+-----------------------------+--------+
| Quota                       | Limit  |
+-----------------------------+--------+
| instances                   | -1     |
| cores                       | 900    |
| ram                         | 460800 |
| floating_ips                | 10     |
| fixed_ips                   | -1     |
| metadata_items              | 128    |
| injected_files              | 5      |
| injected_file_content_bytes | 10240  |
| injected_file_path_bytes    | 255    |
| key_pairs                   | 100    |
| security_groups             | 10     |
| security_group_rules        | 20     |
| server_groups               | 10     |
| server_group_members        | 10     |
+-----------------------------+--------+



I am not sure the last output is suitable (after all the user is gone) 
but this is not the point you are talkging about ,right? are you able to use later env to do it ? 

According to https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/StableBranch
seems we are hard to patch this issue back to Icehouse if it's only in Icehouse
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jichenjc

comments.content:
dear jichenjc：
Thank you for your reply！




There are 3 points need to discuss
(1)
If you never modify the user quota, then the user's quota by default is the same as the tenant.
in fact,there is not record about the user in the table "nova . project_user_quotas" before you modify the user quota

as we see in your comment:
[root@migcont ~] # nova quota-show --tenant 171917e3a16f43ccb48ccb871d71973b
+-----------------------------+--------+
| instances | -1 |
| cores | 900 |
| ram | 460800 |
| floating_ips | 10 |
| fixed_ips | -1 |
| metadata_items | 128 |
| injected_files | 5 |
| injected_file_content_bytes | 10240 |
| injected_file_path_bytes | 255 |
| key_pairs | 100 |
| security_groups | 10 |
| security_group_rules | 20 |
| server_groups | 10 |
| server_group_members | 10 |

[root@migcont ~] # nova quota-show --tenant 171917e3a16f43ccb48ccb871d71973b --user 280e29cbffd14bbc887b22d8372ba119
+-----------------------------+--------+
| Quota | Limit |
+-----------------------------+--------+
| instances | -1 |
| cores | 900 |
| ram | 460800 |
| floating_ips | 10 |
| fixed_ips | -1 |
| metadata_items | 128 |
| injected_files | 5 |
| injected_file_content_bytes | 10240 |
| injected_file_path_bytes | 255 |
| key_pairs | 100 |
| security_groups | 10 |
| security_group_rules | 20 |
| server_groups | 10 |
| server_group_members | 10 |
+-----------------------------+--------+

(2)
In your comment ,it will still show 's quota although you have deleted test2.
This problem may be explained like this :

nova quota-show --tenant 171917e3a16f43ccb48ccb871d71973b --user 280e29cbffd14bbc887b22d8372ba119
the user 280e29cbffd14bbc887b22d8372ba119 has been deleted ,So the result of the actual display is the tenant quotas forthe Parameter "--user" is invalid. 

But this analysis does not explainthe situation (3) 

(3)
in your comment ,You have changed test1 quota.
You can delete the test1, and then look at its quota. 
The result should be as follows:

[root@migcont ~] # nova quota-show --tenant 171917e3a16f43ccb48ccb871d71973b --user 2bac270f3e334221bd70386af0589f81
+-----------------------------+--------+
| Quota | Limit |
+-----------------------------+--------+
| instances | 8 |
| cores | 900 |
| ram | 460800 |
| floating_ips | 10 |
| fixed_ips | -1 |
| metadata_items | 128 |
| injected_files | 5 |
| injected_file_content_bytes | 10240 |
| injected_file_path_bytes | 255 |
| key_pairs | 100 |
| security_groups | 10 |
| security_group_rules | 20 |
| server_groups | 10 |
| server_group_members | 10 |

So I think this bug is still there.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ni-jinquan

comments.content:
Hi, I followed your instructions listed at #0 (I missed or mistyped something?)
and I didn't recreate the problem .. 
so you are talking about the other problem or your original instructions has additional input ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jichenjc

comments.content:
Hi，Can you tell me the result that you execute like this on your  machine
 ：

（1）
keystone user-delete 2bac270f3e334221bd70386af0589f81

（2）
nova quota-show --tenant 171917e3a16f43ccb48ccb871d71973b --user 2bac270f3e334221bd70386af0589f81

comments.content:
um... your point is last one the instance should be -1 instead of 8, right ? because the user is gone...
I need ot find a master env to test it  or check the code maybe
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jichenjc

comments.content:
Thank you for your validation！

Yes I mean:
The last one the instance should not be to 8 because the user is gone

And I think it would be better:
Either user test1  or user test2, as long as you delete the user, when using the command “nova quota-show” to the deleted user.
It should prompt  “the user does not exist”
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ni-jinquan

comments.content:
There is this ML discussion about this bug:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-January/084403.html
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content:
Deleting things in keystone is currently unrelated to Nova quota.

The user will be unable to get a token so this is safe.

Anyways this is a feature request, so its wish list.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: PS note when you delete a user, you have to separetly clean up their resource usage in every service. Note there are tools/scripts about to help with that, but it's out of scope for Nova.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt
